name.text: Implicit Differentiation and Tangent Line Slope

questiontext.text:
Use implicit differentiation to find the slope of the tangent line to the curve

\[{@LHS@} = {@RHS@}\]

at the point \( ({@aa@},{@bb@} ) \) Give your answer as a fraction fully simplified.

Gradient = [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

Let's start by differentiating the left-hand-side of the equation implicitly:

\({@LHS@}\)

Differentiating gives us \({@coef1*(x^2+y^2)@}\cdot (2x+2y\cdot y')\)

\( = ({@coef1*x^2+coef1*y^2@})\cdot (2x+2y\cdot y')\)

\( = ({@coef1*x^2+coef1*y^2@})\cdot 2x+ ({@coef1*x^2+coef1*y^2@}) \cdot 2y\cdot y'\)

\( = {@coef1*x^2*2*x+coef1*y^2*2*x@}+ ({@coef1*x^2*2*y+coef1*y^2*2*y@}) \cdot y'\)



Substituting the values \( ({@aa@},{@bb@} ) \) gives us \( {@coef1*2@}\cdot {@aa@}^3+{@coef1*2@}\cdot {@aa@} \cdot {@bb@}^2+ ({@coef1*2@}\cdot {@aa@}^2 \cdot {@bb@} +{@coef1*2@} \cdot {@bb@}^3) \cdot y'\)

\(= {@coef1*2*aa^3@}+{@coef1*2*aa*bb^2@}+ ({@coef1*2*aa^2*bb@} +{@coef1*2*bb^3@}) \cdot y'\)


\(= {@coef1*2*aa^3+coef1*2*aa*bb^2@}+{@coef1*2*aa^2*bb+coef1*2*bb^3@} \cdot y'\)


Lets now differentiate the right-hand-side:

\({@RHS@}\)

Differentiating gives us \({@coef2@}\cdot (2x - 2y\cdot y')\)

\(= {@coef2*2*x@} - {@coef2 *2*y@}\cdot y'\)

Substituting the values \( ({@aa@},{@bb@} ) \) gives us \({@coef2*2@}\cdot {@aa@} - {@coef2*2@}\cdot {@bb@} \cdot y'\)

\( = {@coef2*2*aa@} - {@coef2*2*bb@} \cdot y'\)

Equating both sides and solving for \(y'\) we get

\({@coef1*2*aa^3+coef1*2*aa*bb^2@}+{@coef1*2*aa^2*bb+coef1*2*bb^3@} \cdot y' = {@coef2*2*aa@} - {@coef2*2*bb@} \cdot y'\)

\({@coef2*2*bb@} \cdot y'+{@coef1*2*aa^2*bb+coef1*2*bb^3@} \cdot y' = {@coef2*2*aa@} - {@coef1*2*aa^3+coef1*2*aa*bb^2@}\)

\({@coef2*2*bb+coef1*2*aa^2*bb+coef1*2*bb^3@} \cdot y' = {@coef2*2*aa-coef1*2*aa^3-coef1*2*aa*bb^2@}\)

\( y' = {@(coef2*2*aa-coef1*2*aa^3-coef1*2*aa*bb^2)/(coef2*2*bb+coef1*2*aa^2*bb+coef1*2*bb^3)@}\)
